snippet: China reported a surge in exports, which could ease the damage from weakness in the domestic economy, but also increase trade tensions with the West.
abstract: China reports its exports surged 15.3 percent in May from a year earlier, which could ease the damage from weakness in the domestic economy, but also increase trade tensions with the West; Chinese factories are outcompeting rivals in developing countries and the West to claim larger market shares even as global demand is barely rising.

headline.main: Selling Abroad, China Eases Slump at Home
headline.print_headline: Selling Abroad, China Eases Slump at Home

snippet: Apps have become vital in marketing mobile technologies to consumers, and the allegiance of app developers to Apple has helped propel the success of its devices.
abstract: Apps have become vital in marketing mobile technologies to consumers and the allegiance of app developers to Apple has helped propel the success of its devices, even as smartphones running Google's Android operating system outsell iPhones more than two to one; Apple will seek to strengthen its ties to mobile developers with a series of product announcements at its developer conference in San Francisco.

headline.main: Google Outsells, but Apple Cultivates Loyalty of App Developers
headline.print_headline: Android Outsells, but Apple Cultivates Loyalty of App Developers

byline.original: By NICK WINGFIELD and BRIAN X. CHEN

snippet: Data will include retail sales and import prices for May, Kroger and Smithfield Foods will report earnings and Apple will hold its annual conference.

headline.main: Economic Reports for the Week Ahead

snippet: Despite the popularity of TV shows like "Game of Thrones," HBO doesn't offer a stand-alone service that allows fans to stream episodes.
abstract: Despite the popularity of TV shows like "Game of Thrones," HBO doesn't offer a stand-alone service that allows fans to stream episodes.

headline.main: Disruptions: For HBO, Still Beholden to a Cable Company
headline.print_headline: Disruptions: For HBO, Still Beholden To a Cable Company

snippet: A guide to cultural and recreational events in Connecticut.
Louise Pitre steps into the title role of “Mame” — made famous by Angela Lansbury in 1966 — at the Goodspeed Opera House in East Haddam, Connecticut.
abstract: Sylviane Gold reviews musical Mame, with music and lyrics by Jerry Herman and book by Jerome Lawrence and Robert E Lee, at the Goodspeed Opera House in East Haddam; Ray Roderick directs and Louise Pitre stars (Metropolitan/Connecticut).

snippet: It’s been said that what Nepal grows best are mountains, but the people living below the Himalayas have developed delicious dishes of grains, nuts, meats and vegetables.
abstract: M H Reed reviews Jewel of Himalaya restaurant in Yorktown Heights (Metropolitan/Westchester).

headline.main: Warm, Spicy Fare From the Himalayas
headline.print_headline: Warm, Spicy Fare From the Himalayas

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Jewel of Himalaya (Yorktown Heights, NY, Restaurant)

snippet: G.M.’s newest telematics approach is a shift from the practice of embedding the technology in the bowels of the car. Instead, the company will offer a link that lets drivers control their phones using the dashboard touch screen.
abstract: General Motor's newest telematics approach is a shift from the practice of embedding the technology in the bowels of the car; instead, the company will offer a link that lets drivers control their phones using the dashboard touch screen.

snippet: With technology’s rapid change, even recent new-music works struggle to duplicate electronic effects of scant decades ago.
abstract: Rapid changes in technology are challenging electronic musicians to be innovative in how they preserve sounds and perform works, some of which are only a decade old.

headline.main: Electronic Woe: The Short Lives of Instruments
headline.print_headline: Electronic Woe: The Short Lives Of Instruments

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Kauffman Center for the Performing Arts

snippet: After cutting the cable TV cord two years ago, I'm often a bit late to the conversations about hot new shows. So last week, after hearing friends rave incessantly about ''Game of Thrones,'' I gave it a try.     Off I went to Apple iTunes, where I ...
abstract: Nick Bilton Disruptions column observes that despite the popularity of television shows like Game of Thrones, HBO does not offer a stand-alone service that allows fans to stream episodes. (M)

headline.main: Disruptions: For HBO, Still Beholden To a Cable Company
